        Thanks for the report! Confirming on Linux d8 at ToT (111.0.5545.0) this morning. <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! Confirming on Linux d8 at ToT (111.0.5545.0) this morning. <!----></span><br><br>This looks like an optimization issue given the need to make the opt() function hot, but there's not enough information for me to tell whether this is a compiler or interpreter issue. Redirecting to v8 folks for further triage. <span class="line"><!---->This looks like an optimization issue given the need to make the opt() function hot, but there's not enough information for me to tell whether this is a compiler or interpreter issue. Redirecting to v8 folks for further triage. <!----></span><br><br>I get a SEGV rather than an ASan report, which is curious, but setting Severity-High on the basis of memory corruption in the sandboxed renderer process. I'm also setting all platforms because this seems likely to be core v8 behavior.<span class="line"><!---->I get a SEGV rather than an ASan report, which is curious, but setting Severity-High on the basis of memory corruption in the sandboxed renderer process. I'm also setting all platforms because this seems likely to be core v8 behavior.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

href="https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5177200834969600"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5177200834969600<!----></a><br><br>To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary. <span class="line"><!---->To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase.         There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<span class="line"><!---->There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = v52<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = v52<!----></span><br><br>And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<!----></span><br><br>But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<!----></span><br><br>Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<span class="line"><!---->Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<!----></span><br><br>I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<span class="line"><!---->I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/0bfae5d1657d078b3596856536a1803944474af4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/0bfae5d1657d078b3596856536a1803944474af4"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/0bfae5d1657d078b3596856536a1803944474af4<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>0bfae5d1657d078b3596856536a1803944474af4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/0bfae5d1657d078b3596856536a1803944474af4"><!---->0bfae5d1657d078b3596856536a1803944474af4<!----></a><br>Author: Thibaud Michaud <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Thibaud Michaud &lt;<!----></span>thibaudm@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/thibaudm@chromium.org"><!---->thibaudm@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jan 19 13:45:16 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jan 19 13:45:16 2023<!----></span><br><br>[gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<span class="line"><!---->[gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<!----></span><br><br>If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<span class="line"><!---->If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<!----></span><br>will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<span class="line"><!---->will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<!----></span><br>moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<span class="line"><!---->moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<!----></span><br>predecessor blocks.<span class="line"><!---->predecessor blocks.<!----></span><br>However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<span class="line"><!---->However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<!----></span><br>mismatch between the source and destination representation.<span class="line"><!---->mismatch between the source and destination representation.<!----></span><br>Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<span class="line"><!---->Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<!----></span><br>truncated.<span class="line"><!---->truncated.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>tebbi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<span class="line"><!---->1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Jan 30 11:59:45 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Jan 30 11:59:45 2023<!----></span><br><br>Merged: [gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<span class="line"><!---->Merged: [gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<!----></span><br><br>If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<span class="line"><!---->If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<!----></span><br>will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<span class="line"><!---->will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<!----></span><br>moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<span class="line"><!---->moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<!----></span><br>predecessor blocks.<span class="line"><!---->predecessor blocks.<!----></span><br>However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<span class="line"><!---->However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<!----></span><br>mismatch between the source and destination representation.<span class="line"><!---->mismatch between the source and destination representation.<!----></span><br>Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<span class="line"><!---->Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<!----></span><br>truncated.<span class="line"><!---->truncated.<!----></span><br><br>R=​<span class="line"><!---->R=​<!----></span>tebbi@chromium.org<a class="undefined"               <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }

        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;

          width: 100%;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;

      text-align: left;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the below 'poc.js' on the release build of v8-11.1.193:<span class="line"><!---->Run the below 'poc.js' on the release build of v8-11.1.193:<!----></span><br><br>```poc.js<span class="line"><!---->```poc.js<!----></span><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    function aux(a, b, c) {<span class="line"><!---->    function aux(a, b, c) {<!----></span><br>        if (a == 4) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (a == 4) {<!----></span><br>            c += b;<span class="line"><!---->            c += b;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        b << c;<span class="line"><!---->        b &lt;&lt; c;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++) {<!----></span><br>        aux(i, aux, i);<span class="line"><!---->        aux(i, aux, i);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    eval(["".concat()].join());<span class="line"><!---->    eval(["".concat()].join());<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 1e4; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 1e4; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>It yields the segmentation fault:<span class="line"><!---->It yields the segmentation fault:<!----></span><br><br>Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 0000000ddd80<span class="line"><!---->Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 0000000ddd80<!----></span><br><br>==== C stack trace ===============================<span class="line"><!---->==== C stack trace ===============================<!----></span><br><br> [0x560bc2b60647]<span class="line"><!----> [0x560bc2b60647]<!----></span><br> [0x7fa409027420]<span class="line"><!----> [0x7fa409027420]<!----></span><br> [0x560b5ff2cc20]<span class="line"><!----> [0x560b5ff2cc20]<!----></span><br>[end of stack trace]<span class="line"><!---->[end of stack trace]<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span class="line"><!---->Linux<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report! Confirming on Linux d8 at ToT (111.0.5545.0) this morning. <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! Confirming on Linux d8 at ToT (111.0.5545.0) this morning. <!----></span><br><br>This looks like an optimization issue given the need to make the opt() function hot, but there's not enough information for me to tell whether this is a compiler or interpreter issue. Redirecting to v8 folks for further triage. <span class="line"><!---->This looks like an optimization issue given the need to make the opt() function hot, but there's not enough information for me to tell whether this is a compiler or interpreter issue. Redirecting to v8 folks for further triage. <!----></span><br><br>I get a SEGV rather than an ASan report, which is curious, but setting Severity-High on the basis of memory corruption in the sandboxed renderer process.         There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<span class="line"><!---->There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = v52<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = v52<!----></span><br><br>And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<!----></span><br><br>But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<!----></span><br><br>Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<span class="line"><!---->Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<!----></span><br><br>I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<span class="line"><!---->I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1407571#c13">Comment 13<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1407571#c13">Comment 13<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 18, 2023, 12:49 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Small clarification: v52 happens to still be stored in rax at this point even though it is marked as spilled, so the optimization makes sense. It's only the representation that doesn't match.<span class="line"><!---->Small clarification: v52 happens to still be stored in rax at this point even though it is marked as spilled, so the optimization makes sense. It's only the representation that doesn't match.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

destination representation<span class="line"><!---->Merged: [gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<!----></span><br><br>If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<span class="line"><!---->If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<!----></span><br>will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<span class="line"><!---->will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<!----></span><br>moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<span class="line"><!---->moving it to the class="line"><!---->mismatch between the source and destination representation.<!----></span><br>Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<span class="line"><!---->Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        }

          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

        }

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;

          display: flex;

          max-width: 1000px;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }

          overflow-y: auto;

        }

          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the below 'poc.js' on the release build of v8-11.1.193:<span class="line"><!---->Run the below 'poc.js' on the release build of v8-11.1.193:<!----></span><br><br>```poc.js<span class="line"><!---->```poc.js<!----></span><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    function aux(a, b, c) {<span class="line"><!---->    function aux(a, b, c) {<!----></span><br>        if (a == 4) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (a == 4) {<!----></span><br>            c += b;<span class="line"><!---->            c += b;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        b << c;<span class="line"><!---->        b &lt;&lt; c;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++) {<!----></span><br>        aux(i, aux, i);<span class="line"><!---->        aux(i, aux, i);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    eval(["".concat()].join());<span class="line"><!---->    eval(["".concat()].join());<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 1e4; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 1e4; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>It yields the segmentation fault:<span class="line"><!---->It yields the segmentation fault:<!----></span><br><br>Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 0000000ddd80<span class="line"><!---->Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 0000000ddd80<!----></span><br><br>==== C stack trace ===============================<span class="line"><!---->==== C stack trace ===============================<!----></span><br><br> [0x560bc2b60647]<span class="line"><!----> [0x560bc2b60647]<!----></span><br> [0x7fa409027420]<span class="line"><!----> [0x7fa409027420]<!----></span><br> [0x560b5ff2cc20]<span class="line"><!----> [0x560b5ff2cc20]<!----></span><br>[end of stack trace]<span class="line"><!---->[end of stack trace]<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span class="line"><!---->Linux<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<span class="line"><!---->There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = v52<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = v52<!----></span><br><br>And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<!----></span><br><br>But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<!----></span><br><br>Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<span class="line"><!---->Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<!----></span><br><br>I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<span class="line"><!---->I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

representation<span class="line"><!---->[gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<!----></span><br><br>If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<span class="line"><!---->If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<!----></span><br>will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<span class="line"><!---->will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<!----></span><br>moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<span class="line"><!---->moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<!----></span><br>predecessor blocks.<span class="line"><!---->predecessor blocks.<!----></span><br>However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<span class="line"><!---->However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<!----></span><br>mismatch between the source and destination representation.<span class="line"><!---->mismatch between the source and destination representation.<!----></span><br>Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<span class="line"><!---->Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<!----></span><br>truncated.<span class="line"><!---->truncated.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>tebbi@chromium.org<a class="undefined"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">

            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>

      </button>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;

          justify-content: flex-start;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the below 'poc.js' on the release build of v8-11.1.193:<span class="line"><!---->Run the below 'poc.js' on the release build of v8-11.1.193:<!----></span><br><br>```poc.js<span class="line"><!---->```poc.js<!----></span><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    function aux(a, b, c) {<span class="line"><!---->    function aux(a, b, c) {<!----></span><br>        if (a == 4) {<span class="line"><!---->        if (a == 4) {<!----></span><br>            c += b;<span class="line"><!---->            c += b;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>        b << c;<span class="line"><!---->        b &lt;&lt; c;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++) {<!----></span><br>        aux(i, aux, i);<span class="line"><!---->        aux(i, aux, i);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    eval(["".concat()].join());<span class="line"><!---->    eval(["".concat()].join());<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 1e4; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 1e4; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>It yields the segmentation fault:<span class="line"><!---->It yields the segmentation fault:<!----></span><br><br>Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 0000000ddd80<span class="line"><!---->Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 0000000ddd80<!----></span><br><br>==== C stack trace ===============================<span class="line"><!---->==== C stack trace ===============================<!----></span><br><br> [0x560bc2b60647]<span class="line"><!----> [0x560bc2b60647]<!----></span><br> [0x7fa409027420]<span class="line"><!----> [0x7fa409027420]<!----></span><br> [0x560b5ff2cc20]<span class="line"><!----> [0x560b5ff2cc20]<!----></span><br>[end of stack trace]<span class="line"><!---->[end of stack trace]<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span class="line"><!---->Linux<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report! Confirming on Linux d8 at ToT (111.0.5545.0) this morning. <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! Confirming on Linux d8 at ToT (111.0.5545.0) this morning. <!----></span><br><br>This looks like an optimization issue given the need to make the opt() function hot, but there's not enough information for me to tell whether this is a compiler or interpreter issue. Redirecting to v8 folks for further triage. <span class="line"><!---->This looks like an optimization issue given the need to make the opt() function hot, but there's not enough information for me to tell whether this is a compiler or interpreter issue. Redirecting to v8 folks for further triage. <!----></span><br><br>I get a SEGV rather than an ASan report, which is curious, but setting Severity-High on the basis of memory corruption in the sandboxed renderer process. I'm also setting all platforms because this seems likely to be core v8 behavior.<span class="line"><!---->I get a SEGV rather than an ASan report, which is curious, but setting Severity-High on the basis of memory corruption in the sandboxed renderer process.         The segv is in the ShiftLeft builtin:<span class="line"><!---->The segv is in the ShiftLeft builtin:<!----></span><br><br>0x7faebfb6406b   8ab  498b85a81b0000       REX.W movq rax,[r13+0x1ba8] (external reference (check_object_type))<span class="line"><!---->0x7faebfb6406b   8ab  498b85a81b0000       REX.W movq rax,[r13+0x1ba8] (external reference         by

        There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<span class="line"><!---->There is some representation mix-up. We emit a gap move to meet a fixed input register constraint:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = v52<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = v52<!----></span><br><br>And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->And v52 is marked as tagged and is spilled, so after the CommitAssignment phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [stack:8|t]<!----></span><br><br>But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<span class="line"><!---->But after the MoveOptimizer phase it becomes:<!----></span><br>[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<span class="line"><!---->[rbx|R|t] = [rax|R|w32]<!----></span><br><br>Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<span class="line"><!---->Which looks off. The gap resolver would previously emit a 'movq' for this move, but after my change it emits a 'movl' based on the source representation.<!----></span><br><br>I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<span class="line"><!---->I will change the gap resolver so that it chooses the move width based on the destination representation again. But I will also look into the move optimizer, because it would be better to avoid such type inconsistencies in the first place<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

representation<span class="line"><!---->[gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<!----></span><br><br>If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<span class="line"><!---->If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<!----></span><br>will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<span class="line"><!---->will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<!----></span><br>moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<span class="line"><!---->moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<!----></span><br>predecessor blocks.<span class="line"><!---->predecessor blocks.<!----></span><br>However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<span class="line"><!---->However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<!----></span><br>mismatch between the source and destination representation.<span class="line"><!---->mismatch between the source and destination representation.<!----></span><br>Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<span class="line"><!---->Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<!----></span><br>truncated.<span class="line"><!---->truncated.<!----></span><br><br>R=<span class="line"><!---->R=<!----></span>tebbi@chromium.org<a class="undefined"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. destination representation<span class="line"><!---->Merged: [gap-resolver] Emit move based on destination representation<!----></span><br><br>If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<span class="line"><!---->If the phi moves are the same for all predecessors, the move optimizer<!----></span><br>will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<span class="line"><!---->will merge them by picking an arbitrary move among them,<!----></span><br>moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<span class="line"><!---->moving it to the phi's block, and eliminating the moves in the<!----></span><br>predecessor blocks.<span class="line"><!---->predecessor blocks.<!----></span><br>However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<span class="line"><!---->However, phi inputs may have different width, and this can result in a<!----></span><br>mismatch between the source and destination representation.<span class="line"><!---->mismatch between the source and destination representation.<!----></span><br>Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<span class="line"><!---->Always emit gap moves based on the destination operand's<!----></span><br>representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<span class="line"><!---->representation, to ensure that in this case the wider phi inputs are not<!----></span><br>truncated.<span class="line"><!---->truncated.<!----></span><br><br>R=​<span class="line"><!---->R=​<!----></span>tebbi@chromium.org<a class="undefined"
